div.l: These iiij sparcles longeth vnto elde
Oure olde lymes mow wel ben vnwelde
But will ne shal nat failen that is soth
And yet haue I alwey a coltes toth
As many a yere as it is passid henne
For syn that my tappe of lif bigan to renne
For sikerly whan I was born̄ anoon̄
Deth drouȝ the tappe of life and leet it goon̄
And euer sythen hath the tappe I ronne
Til almost al empty is the tonne
The streem of lif now droppeth on the chymbe
The sely tonge may wel rynge and chymbe
Of wrecchidnesse that passed is ful yore
With olde folk saue dotage is nomore
Whan̄ that oure oost had herd this sermonyng
He gan to speke as bordely as a kyng
He seid what amounteth all this wit
That shal we speke al day of holy writ
The deuel made a Reue for to speche
Or of a souter shipman or a leche
Sey forth thi tale and tarie nouȝt the tyme
Loo depford and it is half wey prime
Loo Grenewich that many a shrewe is yn
It were al tyme thi tale for to bigynne
Now sires qduod this Osewold the Reue
I pray you that nouȝt you greue
Thouȝ I answer and somdel set his howe
For leefull is with force to showe
This dronken Millere hath I told us here
Hou that bigiled was there a carpentere
ꝐParauenture yn scorn̄ for ik am oon̄
And by your leue I shal him quite anon̄
Riȝt in his cherles termes wol I speke
I pray to god his nekke mot to breke
